headline: Does Trump’s US$1.5 Trillion Defense Plan Rewire The Bull Case For General Dynamics (GD)?
summary: In early January 2026, President Trump proposed lifting the 2027 U.S. military budget to US$1.50 trillion and issued new rules requiring defense contractors such as General Dynamics to prioritize weapons production over shareholder payouts, while capping executive pay and restricting dividends and buybacks until production and maintenance benchmarks are met. The combination of this very large proposed budget increase and tighter conditions on capital returns reshapes how investors think...
